intro: Hedyotis mariannensis, commonly known as the Mariana bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It is a low-growing herb with slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Hedyotis mariannensis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
